data.title: Great food!
data.text: Their hamburgers are good, but their biscuits are great! This is a simple, basic diner with sandwiches for lunch and great breakfasts!

data.title: One of the top in town!
data.text: A few years ago we would not go here if someone else was paying for our meal.  It has new ownership and it has completely turned around.  We love eating here.  The food is great, the service is always thoughtful and wonderful.  Convenient to downtown.  It is a true Murfreesboro icon and if you have not been here in a while give it a try and I bet you will be as impressed as I am.

data.title: A lot of food for the money
data.text: I have to say that they did get our tour group in and out on time.  I really liked the fried okra but found the rest of the meal not so good.  Had a piece of fatty overdone ham and the rest was all carbs.  Of course there is always room for dessert and they did offer that so had the peach cobbler which was good as was the fudge cake.  Busy at lunchtime but convenient for our group and the wait staff was very attentive.

data.title: I know these things happen sometimes...
data.text:
But a hair in my food = automatic poor rating.  It's something that I just can't get over.

Could not eat my breakfast, and won't go back.

data.title: A city icon
data.text: The city Café has been in Murfreesboro for decades.  It is a "go to" place while in town or on the square.  The food is always good.

data.title: Convenient location
data.text: This place is around the square. Walking distance from the court house. Pretty popular place with the locals. The service was friendly but a little bit slow. The food was good but  basic. I had a burger and fries which was fine. My husband also had a burger and frieswhich he said was good. The place could use an update but overall it was a convenient place with decent food.

data.title: Popular meeting place for locals
data.text:
Great restaurant for Saturday morning breakfast. This restaurant is one of the oldest in Murfreesboro. It is located in the heart of Downtown across from the courthouse. 

Nothing fancy as far as decor, but the food is good. Pancakes are pretty good size. The bacon was cooked to my liking which is crispy. 

Service is friendly and fast. Enjoy!

data.title: Average
data.text: After reading the reviews, we expected better. But, bacon was greasy,  eggs just ok, and the biscuits  ok. We just had greater expectations.

data.title: City Cafe brings community together
data.text: Visited Murfreesboro's City Cafe on the way to Bell Buckle last Friday afternoon.  Even at noon the cafe was crowded but tables were opening every few minutes.  As directed on the sign inside the door, we seated ourselves next to other tables where friends and neighbors were already engaged in conversation and good food.  After reviewing the menu and daily specials on the chalk board, my wife chose the fried catfish (6.95) with sides of cream corn and cole slaw and for myself cajun grilled catfish (5.95) with a side of turnip greens (each plate was served with a fluffy yeast roll).  Large servings of catfish and sides were soon delivered to the table!  The fried catfish was amazingly light and supple (little or no greasiness) and the white fish meat very fresh and tasty!  The cajun grilled catfish was lightly grilled and moist every bite!  Such a delicious meal for an incredible affordable price!  This is one of those unique places on the town square that has character, history and charm that can't be duplicated.  Come to Murfreesboro, walk around the square, visit some of the neat shops, then sit down next to your neighbor and break bread together!

data.title: Although very busy on Saturday mornings, great breakfasts with solid country style food affordably priced.
data.text: City Café has friendly folks working the tables and the register.  They feature food that sticks to your ribs and lots of it.  While the ambiance is simple, it has a kind of charm to the old style tables and chairs.  Always a full house on Saturday with the farmer's market going on but worth the wait.

data.title: Politics and Breakfast
data.text: The City Cafe has been an institution in Murfreesboro for decades. Owners have come and gone, but it still remains a great place for breakfast before going to the Farmers Market on the Square. Ham and eggs are great.  My husband to have the tenderloin with his eggs.  Lunch is a good  meat and three.  The menu has specials that change daily. We eat there often and enjoy the atmosphere.  Folks have come there daily and like to discuss politics for years and years.  It is a must for out of towners to get a taste of down-home cooking.

data.title: Quaint, historic restaurant on the Square
data.text: This is a quaint, historic restaurant downtown on the Square, that serves traditional meals for a reasonable price.

data.title: Not many like this
data.text: This is a quaint little hometown place on the Murfreesboro Square.  It is not fancy on the inside at all but the service and food are good. Real home style cooking and menu.

data.title: Best biscuits on the planet, seriously!
data.text: We have started a tradition of Saturday breakfast out, and we seek out the quaint and out of the way places to explore and experience.  This little gem was a treat! Breakfast was sooo good and you just have to taste the biscuits for yourself!  The prices were very reasonable and the service was excellent: friendly and fast, even though it was already pretty crowded by the time we got there.  This place should be on your list if you live anywhere near the Murfreesboro area and haven't been yet, or if you are just passing through!

data.title: Back in time.
data.text: I love the patty melts at the City Cafe. If you are looking to step back in time this is the little diner for you. Check out the checkerboard floors and old time booths.

data.title: Surprisingly Delightful
data.text: This is one of the older restaurants in the city. Walking into the City Cafe reminded me of what seems to be the distant past (40 plus years). The occasion was a father/daughter breakfast. The staff was very cordial and the food was good. With all the restaurants in the city, this one just off the square doesn't appear to get all the traffic that the newer ones get but if you want to get away from the crowds and hang out with the locals, try it.

data.title: Friendly family restaurant
data.text: First visit after many years, and I was very happy with everything.  Very busy when we arrived, but we only waited about 5 minutes.  Great country-style breakfast, friendly staff, and reasonable prices.  Love the fact that it's a local business, too.  Will definitely be back!

data.title: Love to have breakfast here!
data.text: We try to make a point to drop in for breakfast whenever we are "downtown" on the Square to enjoy City Cafe's terrific breakfast fare.

data.title: Delicious food
data.text: Was visiting my son and he suggested that we have breakfast here. Prices were good and lots of food, good food for money. Worth going for, I'll be back next visit.

data.title: I really wish I had waited to order AFTER they started parading other customer's food by our table...
data.text:
Friend and I got there about the breakfast/lunch switchover. He ordered breakfast and I ordered lunch. I get a meat and two. We are sitting there eating and talking when I look back toward the kitchen - out comes a burger with 2 legs! It slowly walks by the table and I think it winked at me! No wait, that was the waitress hiding behind it...

Ever been to the beach and watch guys when a girl walks by. In unison all their heads turn and follow her until she reaches her beach towel and her tattooed and muscled boyfriend. At which point they start looking at the sky, the ocean, the sand, seagulls....this burger was the food equivalent to a girl in a bikini walking on the beach. Diners were mostly men and all heads turned and following that plate to it's destination. It was about 8" tall with 2 patties, double cheese, a pile of leaf lettuce - not that stringy shredded stuff and THICK tomatoes, not those anger inducing paper thin slices that you pay 50 cents extra for at some fast food places. I didn't see anything speared down the middle to keep it from tipping over, so the waitress must have worked as a juggler at her former job.  

Wait - back to what I ordered - too busy thinking about the future. Country steak with white gravy, green beans and mashed potatoes with gravy. Beans were awesome as were the mashed potatoes. Country fried steak - it was OK. One issue - it had white gravy and the potatoes had brown - wasn't expected that so I didn't know to specify. Had to ask for cornbread - fried cornbread. It was good - not great. Friend got breakfast with country ham, eggs, shredded hashbrowns, 2 eggs, biscuit and gravy. Decent size piece of ham. Eggs were cooked perfectly. Think the potatoes were institutional. He didn't eat them, but I think he just didn't want them.

Will I be back? Ummm...yeah! I have a double cheeseburger with my name on it! That's just a saying, in case you were wondering...you can't write on meat...
